ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b la cʉ́ʼʉ léfó Kánàhan ńgʉa, ḿbú ńkaa shúm sé ntsèm ńdɔg ńgʉa. À la gʉa tà ńkúu Mbɛɛshÿeba, ńdɔg lezíŋ Ssé tá we Ésàg ńnuŋe pwɔʼ.
en: Israel set out with all that he had and came to Beer-sheba,   and he offered sacrifices to the God of his father Isaac.

ngiemboon: Á gÿo ńgwɔ́ letsẅɛ́ʼ, e Ssé tóŋo yé tsɛ̀ɛ njÿòon ngie: «Yakwɔ̂b! Yakwɔ̂b!» Yakwɔ̂b gɔɔn ngie: «Wɔ́ɔn wɔɔn!»
en: That night God spoke to Israel in a vision:   “Jacob, Jacob! ” he said.

ngiemboon: E Ssé gíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «N gee Ssé, é Ssé tá gù! Te pɔ́gɔ lécwóŋo Egíbtò. Ńtí nue, n ge kúu wó, é gÿo, ngẅɛ̀ jù pú ńgyɔ́ɔn.
en: God said, “I am God, the God of your father. Do not be afraid to go down to Egypt, for I will make you into a great nation there.

ngiemboon: Kwàʼ mèŋ n ge lɔgɔ gú gʉa Egíbtò, é piŋ gÿo lɔgɔ gú piŋ nzèm. Yesyɛ̂b zɔ ge láʼ pwɔ́ʼ nÿɔ́g mú fʉ̀ʼ gie ɔ̀ kwě.»
en: I will go down with you to Egypt, and I will also bring you back.   Joseph will close your eyes when you die.”  # 46:4 Lit will put his hand on your eyes,# 46:4 Gn 50:1

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b fó Mbɛɛshÿeba ńgʉa. Ńgwaa gʉa púʼu, penkʉ́ pé kaa yé, ńkaa gubé yɔ́b, ńkaa mezwě pɔ́b tsɛ̀ɛ mekélêg lÿóon mie Falahoŋ la túm lélɔg ńkaa yé.
en: Jacob left Beer-sheba. The sons of Israel took their father Jacob in the wagons Pharaoh had sent to carry him,   along with their dependents and their wives.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b pâ ngẅɛ̀ ye ntsèm la gwaa cwóŋ né Egíbtò, ḿbú ńkaa menɔ̀ɔn tà mbɔɔ shúm sie pɔ́ la laba ngwòŋ Kánàhan.
en: They also took their cattle and possessions they had acquired in the land of Canaan. Then Jacob and all his offspring with him came to Egypt.

ngiemboon: À la pú ńdɔg ngẅɛ̀ ye ntsèm ńcwóŋ né Egíbtò: é penkʉ́ pé pembàŋa lâ penkʉ́ penkʉ́ pé pembàŋa, ńgÿo penkʉ́ pé pepanzwě lâ penkʉ́ penkʉ́ pé pepanzwě.
en: His sons and grandsons, his daughters and granddaughters, indeed all his offspring, he brought with him to Egypt.

ngiemboon: Mezíŋ pʉ̀a Ésàlayɛ pie é la gʉa né ngwòŋ Egíbtò, léfó na Yakwɔ̂b ńkú gubé yé, ńgÿo gubé gubé yé, é mɔɔn:
en: These are the names of the sons of Israel who came to Egypt    #— #Jacob and his sons:

ngiemboon: é mɔɔn: wɔɔn laa Anɔg, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Palu, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Eseloŋ ńgÿo Kaami, é pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbàŋa.
en: Reuben’s sons:   Hanoch, Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.

ngiemboon: Egubé Simeyoŋ pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbàŋa: wɔɔn laa Yemuyɛ̂ɛ, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Yamɛŋ, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Ohad, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Yakiŋ ńgÿo Tsowa, tá ńgÿo Saẅi míŋ nzwě we gẅie aa múɔ Kánàhan.
en: Simeon’s sons:   Jemuel, Jamin, Ohad, Jachin, Zohar, and Shaul, the son of a Canaanite woman.

ngiemboon: Mezíŋ gubé Lěvî é mɔɔn: wɔɔn laa Ngeshÿoŋ, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Kehad ńgÿo Melali, é pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbàŋa.
en: Levi’s sons:   Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

ngiemboon: Mezíŋ gubé Yúndà é mɔɔn: wɔɔn laa Ɛɛ, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Onâŋ, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Shÿélà, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Pelɛg ńgÿo Zela, é pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbàŋa. Táʼ, Ɛɛ pɔ́ Onâŋ la kwéte tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Kánàhan. Penkʉ́ Pelɛg gwɔ́ Eseloŋ pɔ́ Amúu, é pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbàŋa.
en: Judah’s sons: Er, Onan, Shelah, Perez, and Zerah; but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan.

ngiemboon: Mezíŋ gubé Esakaa gwɔ́ Tola, Puva, Yɔb ńgÿo Shʉmloŋ, é pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbàŋa.
en: Issachar’s sons:   Tola, Puvah,  # 46:13 Sam, Syr read Puah; 1Ch 7:1 Jashub,  # 46:13 Sam, LXX; MT reads Iob and Shimron.

ngiemboon: Penkʉ́ Zambuloŋ gwɔ́ Selɛd, Eloŋ ńgÿo Yaleyɛle, é pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbàŋa.
en: Zebulun’s sons: Sered, Elon, and Jahleel.

ngiemboon: Pɔɔn ée penkʉ́ pie Léyà pɔ́ Yakwɔ̂b la zyé kwòŋo Alam. Ńgwɔ́ gie mé lɔɔn ńkẅiʼi Ndínà míŋ we wemanzwě né penkʉ́ pé pembàŋa ńgÿo pepanzwě, pɔ́ lɔgɔ ḿbú ńgwɔ́ ntsɔ̀b tá né móm tá.
en: These were Leah’s sons born to Jacob in Paddan-aram, as well as his daughter Dinah. The total number of persons:    thirty-three.

ngiemboon: Penkʉ́ Ngâd gwɔ́ Tsifiyoŋ, Angi, Shuni, Ɛtsemboŋ, Ɛli, Alondi ńgÿo Aleli, é pú ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ mbàŋa.
en: Gad’s sons: Ziphion, Haggi, Shuni, Ezbon, Eri, Arodi, and Areli.

ngiemboon: Mezíŋ gubé Ashÿɛ̂ɛ yembàŋa gwɔ́ Yimna, Ishÿeva, Ishÿevi, Mbeliya ńgÿo Sela fɛ̌ wɔ́b wemanzwě. Té lege Ébɛ̀ɛ pɔ́ Malekiyɛ pie ée penkʉ́ Mbelia.
en: Asher’s sons:   Imnah, Ishvah, Ishvi, Beriah, and their sister Serah.

ngiemboon: Pɔɔn lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ penkʉ́ Zilépà gẅie Lambaŋ la náa mbwó míŋ we Léyà á cʉ́ʼʉ ngàŋafàʼ we. É lɔgɔ ḿbú ńgwɔ́ penkʉ́ ntsɔ̀b ntɔgɔ́ né legém pie Zilépà pɔ́ Yakwɔ̂b la zyé.
en: These were the sons of Zilpah #— #whom Laban gave to his daughter Leah #— #that she bore to Jacob: sixteen persons.

ngiemboon: Egubé Lǎshÿɛ̂ nzwě Yakwɔ̂b gwɔ́ Yesyɛ̂b pɔ́ Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ.
en: The sons of Jacob’s wife Rachel: Joseph and Benjamin.

ngiemboon: Egubé gie Yesyɛ̂b la zyé ngwòŋ Egíbtò yɔɔn: Manase ńgÿo Efalayîm. Yɔɔn ée gubé gie Yesyɛ̂b pɔ́ Asenad míŋ Potí-fela gẅie aa nùŋepwɔʼ ssé Oŋ la zyé.
en: Manasseh and Ephraim were born to Joseph in the land of Egypt. They were born to him by Asenath daughter of Potiphera, a priest at On.

ngiemboon: Penkʉ́ Mbɛŋjÿamɛŋ gwɔ́ Mbélà, Mbekɛɛ, Ashÿembɛɛ, Ngelaa, Naamaŋ, Eyî, Lɔshÿe, Mupîm, Upîm ńgÿo Âd.
en: Benjamin’s sons:   Bela, Becher, Ashbel, Gera, Naaman, Ehi, Rosh, Muppim, Huppim, and Ard.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn metsìŋendá ntsɔ̀b lekùɔ né legém, lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ ngẅɛ̀ Yakwɔ̂b pɔ́ Lǎshÿɛ̂.
en: These were Rachel’s sons who were born to Jacob: fourteen persons.

ngiemboon: Míŋ Ndaŋ gwɔ́ Ushʉ̂m.
en: Dan’s son:   Hushim.

ngiemboon: Egubé Nɛbtali gwɔ́ Yasiyɛ̂ɛ, Nguni, Yezɛ̂ɛ ńgÿo Shʉlɛ̂m.
en: Naphtali’s sons:   Jahzeel, Guni, Jezer, and Shillem.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn metsìŋendá sɔɔnmbʉ́a lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ me Yakwɔ̂b pɔ́ Mbila gẅie Lambaŋ la náa mbwó míŋ we Lǎshÿɛ̂ á cʉ́ʼʉ ngàŋafàʼ we.
en: These were the sons of Bilhah, whom Laban gave to his daughter Rachel.   She bore to Jacob: seven persons.

ngiemboon: Zyé Yakwɔ̂b gẅie à la lɔg ḿbú ńgee ngwòŋ Egíbtò, é laa pʉ̀a ntsɔ̀b ntɔgɔ́ lé móm ntɔgɔ́ té sáŋ mezwě penkʉ́ pé.
en: The total number of persons belonging to Jacob #— #his direct descendants,   not including the wives of Jacob’s sons #— #who came to Egypt: sixty-six.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ gie mé lɔɔn ńkẅiʼi penkʉ́ Yesyɛ̂b pépʉ́a pie à la zyé ngwòŋ Egíbtò na pɔ́b, mbà pʉ̀a pie Yakwɔ̂b la lɔg ḿbú ńnéŋe Egíbtò lɔgɔ ńgwɔ́ móm sɔɔnmbʉ́a.
en: And Joseph’s sons who were born to him in Egypt: two persons.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b la tʉ́ njÿó, ńtúmo Yúndà mbwó Yesyɛ̂b páʼ pɔ́ záʼa wɔ́b Ngɔshÿɛn. Pɔ́ la gʉa tà ńkúu Ngɔshÿɛn,
en: Now Jacob had sent Judah ahead of him to Joseph to prepare for his arrival   at Goshen.  # 46:28 Gn 45:10 When they came to the land of Goshen,

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b lwo ńcwoŋte kélêg lÿóon we, ńkúu tsoló, ńgʉa ńzáʼa tá we Yakwɔ̂b, á Ngɔshÿɛn. Ńdeen ńgʉa tà ńtsɛ́ɛ yé, ńkyɛ́, ḿbéle na yé, ńzye ńdʉa.
en: Joseph hitched the horses to his chariot and went up to Goshen to meet his father Israel. Joseph presented himself to him, threw his arms around him, and wept for a long time.

ngiemboon: Yakwɔ̂b gɔɔn né Yesyɛ̂b ngie: «Afʉ̀ʼɔɔn la, ngwɔ́ n deen ńké ńkwé, ńtí nue n gǐŋ sɔb nÿɔ́g na gù, tà ɔ̀ nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ntʉ̀ntʉ̀.»
en: Then Israel said to Joseph, “I’m ready to die now because I have seen your face and you are still alive! ”

ngiemboon: Yesyɛ̂b gɔɔn né mefɛ̌ pé, tà mbɔɔ né petsɔ́ pʉ̀a na ngẅɛ̀ ndá tá we ngie: «Tà m bʉ éshwóŋo Falahoŋ ngie mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn tà mbɔɔ pʉ̀a metsèm na ngẅɛ̀ ndá tá wɔ́ɔn pie é kaa Kánàhan, pǔ ńtó, ńtsɛ́ɛ wɔ́ɔn.
en: Joseph said to his brothers and to his father’s family, “I will go up and inform Pharaoh, telling him, ‘My brothers and my father’s family, who were in the land of Canaan, have come to me.

ngiemboon: N ge kú shwóŋo yé ngie pi ée pasẅɛ menɔ̀ɔn, mbà pi kɔ̌ɔn ḿpféle menɔ̀ɔn. Ngie pi ka lɔg menjʉ̀njÿò mí lâ mvfó gí, ńgÿo mefòŋ mí, tà mbɔɔ shúm sí ntsèm, ńtó.
en: The men are shepherds; they also raise livestock. They have brought their flocks and herds and all that they have.’

ngiemboon: Falahoŋ lɔɔn ńtóŋo gẅí, ńzɛ́te gẅí ngie pi zsé légÿo kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ?
en: When Pharaoh addresses you and asks, ‘What is your occupation? ’

ngiemboon: Pi tsɔ́ʼ ngie pi la lu ssé, pi ée ńké sẅɛɛ pɔ́ menɔ̀ɔn páʼ metá pí tà ńkú fʉ̀ʼɔɔn. Ńzsé ngie mé nǎa jʉʼ tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Ngɔshÿɛn, pi néŋe wó. Ńtí nue pʉ̀a Egíbtò é pʉa papféle menjʉ̀njÿò pâ mvfó.»
en: you are to say, ‘Your servants, both we and our ancestors, have raised livestock   from our youth until now.’ Then you will be allowed to settle in the land of Goshen, since all shepherds are detestable to Egyptians.”  # 46:34 Gn 43:32; Ex 8:26
